title: I am in california,can I file bankrupcy and keep my cotractors licence
question: I need to file bankrupcy ,,Ineed to keep my contractors licence
question_tags: Liquidating business assets,Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Bankruptcy liquidation,Bankruptcy and debt,Business,Lawsuits and disputes
answers:
As a general rule, filing bankruptcy does not affect your licenses.

Good luck!

All of my clients who held their contractor's license in good standing at the time they file their bankruptcy, had no problems keeping their license. For the few clients who had a suspended license at the time they filed their case, the filing of the bankruptcy restored the license to good standing in full.

Each case is different so you need to have someone discuss the facts in your case with you. Most attorneys give a free consultation so feel free to call me or another attorney to discuss your case for free.

Bankruptcy is based on liquidation principles and most people considering bankruptcy have nothing to liquidate. Make sure you discuss your assets with an attorney because things like lawsuits and business goodwill are assets that are hard to value.

As a contractor you are required to notify the CSLB if you file bankruptcy. Whether or not you keep your license depends on the debts you are seeking to discharge. If none of them are related to your construction work it should not be a problem to keep your license. If they are related but end up being discharged or fully satisfied you should also be able to have your license.

Call the CSLB and ask them directly. 916 255-3237
